question: Which Article of the Constitutions deals with dispute arising out of any pre-constitution treaty, agreement and covenant?
explanation: Article 143 of the Indian Constitution authorises the president to seek the opinion of the Supreme Court on the following matters: (1) On any question of law or fact of public importance which has arisen or which is likely to arise and (2) On any dispute arising out of any pre-constitution treaty, agreement, covenant, engagement, sanad or other similar instruments.
